title: Nick Got His Punch Line Audition - Gregway 08.29.24
description:
Support us with a Kinda Funny Membership here on YouTube or on http://www.patreon.com/kindafunny 

Nick talks about the long, rewarding process of getting his host audition at the world famous Punch Line Comedy Club.

The Kinda Funny Membership gets you Ad-Free and Exclusive Shows: https://www.youtube.com/KindaFunnyGames/join

transcript_chunks.text: if you've enjoyed the content we've made so far in 2024 we're asking you to pick up a kind of funny membership on patreon.com kindof funny or youtube.com/ kindof funny games to say thanks as part of August's kind of funny membership drive that 10 spot would get you access to more than 130 exclusive episodes of content and to give you a taste we're posting one of the exclusive Greg ways just like this each and every Saturday and Sunday in August on top of that make sure you join us for weekly public happy hours where we take patreon member calls live for everyone's previews of what a kind of funny membership gets you each and every month yo what the heck is going on everybody welcome to your Greg way for August 29th that is correct I am Nick that is also correct uh Greg is out of town I believe he's going to PX uh so look on his socials and all that stuff to see all the cool stuff he is doing uh but in the interum I wanted to share some fun news with you guys um I don't know if you guys

he's going to PX uh so look on his socials and all that stuff to see all the cool stuff he is doing uh but in the interum I wanted to share some fun news with you guys um I don't know if you guys if everyone out there saw waiting for the punchline but that was a documentary that I made um we made that a few years back now I think it was maybe 6 7 years ago um and it was about my my first year in comedy um and all the stuff that it took to sort of do open mics and get enough material and then go basically uh uh try to get up at the punch line which is the world famous club here in Northern California in San Francisco and the process for that was uh it's pretty straightforward it's pretty laid out that we have a thing called the Sunday showcase which has been happening for a long time and during that Sunday showcase uh every single comic that wants to be passed at the club uh or wants to be a paid regular at the club I should say uh you go there on Sunday you check in with the with the

that Sunday showcase uh every single comic that wants to be passed at the club uh or wants to be a paid regular at the club I should say uh you go there on Sunday you check in with the with the booker uh and you hang out and you meet people uh and you basically get a chance to watch all the more established Comics who are already either past or on the way to being past you get to watch them perform and then if you go for enough time usually I think it was like 7 to n months uh you got to go up and do your first uh your your first set there and you get about 5 minutes I think at the beginning um so I did waiting for the punchline my first year uh uh to sort of document that process and to show everyone how cool our scene was and to sort of introduce some of you all to uh some of my friends that I had made in comedy like my buddy Jan uh and uh I mean a bunch of other people that you guys probably seen my buddy Austin um who I believe was featured a little bit in as well as my friend

that I had made in comedy like my buddy Jan uh and uh I mean a bunch of other people that you guys probably seen my buddy Austin um who I believe was featured a little bit in as well as my friend Allan um so that was a really cool process um when I first started doing standup but the goal was always to sort of highlight what it takes to become a professional standup comedian um and in doing that we sort of I think we showed you a little bit of the process of what it takes to actually get your audition eventually and auditions basically is what the end all goal is for someone who's just starting off in a scene you want to get what's called pasted uh at the clubs and what that means is you pass your audition so you become a paid regular so the term passed that's what it comes from is like hey I passed or you are passed a person is passed means they have passed their audition um and the first audition you come to is What's called the host audition uh that is uh your ability to basically

I passed or you are passed a person is passed means they have passed their audition um and the first audition you come to is What's called the host audition uh that is uh your ability to basically the club looks at you and says you've got everything it takes to be a host for us meaning you can start a show if there's a headliner coming into town or if it's a showcase Style Show um you have the ability basically to uh to be the person that we they go to to book for that so you book a whole weekend basically be like Thursday Friday Saturday maybe Sunday um depending on what the headliner was doing or for a one-off show like at cobs or something cool like that U maybe they tap you to come host those showcase shows we do something called the all store show which is basically like some of the best of the best in San Francisco come and it's you know it's a showcase show um so to back that up even further there showcases there then there's headliner shows those are the two main sort of uh

best of the best in San Francisco come and it's you know it's a showcase show um so to back that up even further there showcases there then there's headliner shows those are the two main sort of uh comedy like style of shows for comedy a showcase is basically everyone's doing 10 to 15 minutes um and then some people do maybe 20 to 25 minutes and then a he ler show traditionally is 15-minute host 25 20 to 25 minute feature and then the headliner could do 45 minutes to an hour um and so you'll see and maybe a couple guest sets mixed in there depending on who anyone brought so backing it up when I started doing comedy the goal was to well basically just go up for my first time at punchline which was a nerve-wracking experience all its own the the the experience of doing an open mic was was nerve ranking and then to think past that and say oh my gosh I'm going to walk into a real comedy club and try to actually be you know a real comedian um and do this at a place that people come to

nerve ranking and then to think past that and say oh my gosh I'm going to walk into a real comedy club and try to actually be you know a real comedian um and do this at a place that people come to expecting comedy and expecting professionalism that was to me a crazy ass goal so I I took it you know I think the documentary was was mostly focused on um it it was mostly focused on just that first year leading up to just getting that very first set and if you watch the documentary um well no spoiler but eventually I got my first set of punchline um and it was fun and it was nerve-wracking and it was crazy and it was H you know shout out to everyone that runs punchline and the management and the booker for um you know putting up with me during that process because um I know that it was annoying and it's outside it's adding work two people's plates and uh in an already sort of you know hectic environment so shout out to everyone at punchline that helped make that happen and everyone in the

and it's outside it's adding work two people's plates and uh in an already sort of you know hectic environment so shout out to everyone at punchline that helped make that happen and everyone in the scene that made that happen um but flashing forward now so after that and when I really started doubling down on taking my comedy career a little bit more seriously um which I it's weird to say maybe wasn't at the beginning I think at the beginning I was like hey I'm I've dipped a toe into this but I think and a lot of my my hard my my best friends in the scene sort of had to have a conversation with me like hey you know if you want to do this for real you got to take it a little bit more seriously you can't just do a few mics here and there and then out your shows and kind of be a hobbyist about it if you really want to do this you have to do it or you have to get out of the way and and Clear the Stage for other people who who who really want want it because this is a calling for people

it if you really want to do this you have to do it or you have to get out of the way and and Clear the Stage for other people who who who really want want it because this is a calling for people and that was a gut check moment for me I remember my friend Austin said that to me he was like I was like I wonder why I'm not getting booked so much and he was like well cuz people view you as a hobbyist and I was like I wonder why that is and then I had to take a hard look at myself and I was like well I was the maybe I was the internet guy that had a following that came in and just thought I'll crush this and I'll bring my following and and it'll be easier for me because I already am established another area of of entertainment um and once I sort of realized that I was like Oh no you're just because we were great over here and doing all this amazing stuff with all of you guys does not necessarily translate to me being a good comic and looking back on those earlier sets it did not um I was

we were great over here and doing all this amazing stuff with all of you guys does not necessarily translate to me being a good comic and looking back on those earlier sets it did not um I was not good I was a hobbyist and I think that I needed to sort of put a lot more time and a lot more effort a lot more thought and a lot more just earnst um into my career in that in that area while also still maintaining my career here it kind of funny uh so once I started really going on that then the new like once I started actually committing to the process and really committing to this like hey I'm in I'm in this system I want to be a pay regular punchline that then became the goal and that became a goal that was it's intimidating and and wild because it's it could take a long time there's a lot of really great comics in the scene there's a lot of comics that are you know have been doing it longer a lot of comics that are just more unique more funny I mean all sorts of things and so to me it

of really great comics in the scene there's a lot of comics that are you know have been doing it longer a lot of comics that are just more unique more funny I mean all sorts of things and so to me it just became a matter of like looking at it and saying okay I really want this thing am I willing to put the work in am I willing to you know prove to everyone around me that I'm worth having on a show am I worth you know am I funny enough to be you know a a a good asset to the club am I hardworking enough can I be a good host and that became a very big priority for me and I want you know that's still a priority for me to this day I want to do it um but somewhere around around about a few months ago I started feeling like um you know I started going up a little bit more often a punchline and having pretty good sets and then I was you know kind of working on my my longer host set um with the idea in mind that hopefully the next year or two I could get the audition and to put in context when

pretty good sets and then I was you know kind of working on my my longer host set um with the idea in mind that hopefully the next year or two I could get the audition and to put in context when you go up at punchline on the Sunday showcase you get about six to seven minutes uh unless you are closing it out or hosting and then you get 10 minutes but your host uh uh audition is 15 minutes and so in the of your brain you have to be like hey I need enough material for this I need to be doing this um you know with that in mind of of even though normal sets are 10 to 12 minutes you need to be ready for this cuz it you know it could come at any time um and two weeks ago I got the email from the booker saying hey um we'd like you to come audition for us and so that's when I think the well tremendous amount of anxiety set in but the excitement set in for me um and so I basically was like okay who do I know in the scene that's that I could lean on who could give me longer set so I could

tremendous amount of anxiety set in but the excitement set in for me um and so I basically was like okay who do I know in the scene that's that I could lean on who could give me longer set so I could definitely make sure my 15 is as tight as I can get it you know I'm not saying I have the world's best 15 minutes of Comedy but um I want I definitely wanted to go up there and make sure that the show was good and that everyone had a good time and that uh whoever was coming after me whether it be the feature a headline or a guess set set those people up for Success right and make sure that you know your my number one priority was everyone in the audience knew the second the show started that we were going to have a good time and so August 27th at 7:30 p.m. um for the headliner show for Johnny Taylor who was headlining I got my opportunity to audition for punchline uh and it was a blast and it was an honor and it was awesome um and I uh I have gone back and watched it and you know it just

Taylor who was headlining I got my opportunity to audition for punchline uh and it was a blast and it was an honor and it was awesome um and I uh I have gone back and watched it and you know it just really cool to be able to do that um I've sent the tape away to to the powers that be I have not heard back from them yet so I don't know necessarily if I have passed or not but honestly just being able to get to this point and do this is really really cool um I'm I'm I'm I want to just it's it's cool for a lot of reasons one because you can look back and see progress so I can go back and watch that first set that I did at brainwash Cafe and go okay well I'm at least better than that um and two you know when I reached out to everyone to say hey I'd like to prepare for this a little bit can you guys give me some time on your on your shows everyone said yes and so it was just really nice to be validated and be like I have a lot of friends in the who are willing to help me out um and I'm
